questions.text: Which fraction shows 1 part out of 2 equal parts?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 1/2 means 1 part out of 2 equal parts. The bottom number (denominator) tells us how many equal parts, and the top number (numerator) tells us how many parts we have.

questions.text: A pizza is cut into 4 equal slices. If you eat 2 slices, what fraction of the pizza did you eat?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 2 slices out of 4 equal parts = 2/4

questions.text: 1/2 and 2/4 are equivalent fractions.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 1/2 = 2/4 because if you multiply both the top and bottom of 1/2 by 2, you get 2/4.

questions.text: Which fraction is greater: 1/4 or 1/2?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: When comparing fractions with the same numerator, the one with the smaller denominator is larger. 1/2 > 1/4

questions.text: Match each fraction to its description.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 1/2 = one half, 1/4 = one quarter, 3/4 = three quarters, 4/4 = one whole

questions.text: 3/3 equals 1 whole.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: When the numerator equals the denominator, the fraction equals 1 whole.

questions.text: Place the fractions on the number line from smallest to largest.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Order from smallest to largest: 1/4, 2/4, 3/4

questions.text: What fraction of the shape is shaded if 2 out of 6 equal parts are colored?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 2 parts shaded out of 6 total equal parts = 2/6

questions.text: 2/8 is greater than 3/8.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: When denominators are the same, compare numerators. 2 < 3, so 2/8 < 3/8.

questions.text: Which fraction is equivalent to 2/4?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 2/4 simplified is 1/2 (divide both by 2)

questions.text: If a rectangle is divided into 8 equal parts and 5 are shaded, what fraction is NOT shaded?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 8 total parts - 5 shaded = 3 unshaded parts. So 3/8 is not shaded.

questions.text: Match equivalent fractions.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: The fraction 0/5 equals 0.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: When the numerator is 0, the fraction equals 0, regardless of the denominator.

questions.text: Where does 1/2 go on the number line from 0 to 1?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 1/2 is exactly halfway between 0 and 1 on the number line.

questions.text: Compare the fractions and place them in order.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: What does the top number in a fraction tell us?

choices: How many equal parts the whole is divided into

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: The top number (numerator) tells us how many parts we have or are counting.

questions.text: What does the bottom number in a fraction tell us?

choices: How many equal parts the whole is divided into
questionOptions.correctAnswer: How many equal parts the whole is divided into

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: The bottom number (denominator) tells us how many equal parts the whole is divided into.

questions.text: A circle is divided into 3 equal parts. One part is shaded. What fraction is shaded?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 1 part shaded out of 3 equal parts = 1/3

questions.text: 4/4 equals one whole.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: When the numerator equals the denominator, the fraction equals 1 whole. 4/4 = 1

questions.text: If you have 1 whole cookie and eat half, what fraction is left?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: If you eat half of a cookie, the other half (1/2) is left.

questions.text: Match each fraction to how many equal parts the whole is divided into.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: The denominator tells us the number of equal parts: 1/2 has 2 parts, 1/3 has 3 parts, 1/4 has 4 parts, 1/8 has 8 parts.

questions.text: A sandwich is cut into 6 equal pieces. Maria eats 3 pieces. What fraction did Maria eat?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Maria ate 3 pieces out of 6 equal pieces = 3/6

questions.text: 6/6 is equal to 1.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: When the numerator equals the denominator, the fraction equals 1 whole.

questions.text: Which point on a number line shows 0?

choices: The starting point on the left
The ending point on the right
questionOptions.correctAnswer: The starting point on the left

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: On a number line from 0 to 1, zero is at the starting point on the left.

questions.text: A number line is divided into 4 equal parts. What fraction does each part represent?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: If a number line from 0 to 1 is divided into 4 equal parts, each part represents 1/4.

questions.text: 1/3 is larger than 1/2.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: When comparing unit fractions, the one with the smaller denominator is larger. 1/2 > 1/3

questions.text: Which fraction is equivalent to 3/6?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 3/6 = 1/2 because both the numerator and denominator can be divided by 3.

questions.text: Which is larger: 3/4 or 2/4?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: When denominators are the same, compare numerators. 3 > 2, so 3/4 > 2/4.

questions.text: 2/2 and 4/4 both equal 1 whole.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Any fraction where the numerator equals the denominator equals 1 whole.

questions.text: Place the unit fractions in order from smallest to largest.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: For unit fractions, the larger the denominator, the smaller the fraction: 1/8 < 1/4 < 1/2

questions.text: What fraction names the point at 3/4 on a number line?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: If a number line from 0 to 1 is divided into 4 equal parts, the third mark represents 3/4.

questions.text: Match each fraction with a comparison symbol.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: If a pie is cut into 8 equal slices and Tom eats 4 slices, what equivalent fraction in simplest form shows how much Tom ate?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 4/8 = 1/2 when simplified (divide both by 4).

questions.text: 5/8 is greater than 5/6.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: When comparing fractions with the same numerator, the one with the smaller denominator is larger. 5/6 > 5/8

questions.text: Which fraction is between 1/4 and 3/4 on a number line?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: On a number line, 2/4 falls between 1/4 and 3/4.

questions.text: Match each fraction to its location on a number line from 0 to 1.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 0/4 = 0, 1/4 is one quarter of the way, 2/4 is halfway, 4/4 = 1

questions.text: A number line from 0 to 1 is divided into 6 equal parts. What fraction represents 4 of those parts?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 4 parts out of 6 equal parts = 4/6

questions.text: Sara has a ribbon. She uses 2/8 of it for a craft project. Her friend uses 1/4 of an identical ribbon. Did they use the same amount?

choices: Yes, they used the same amount
questionOptions.correctAnswer: Yes, they used the same amount

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 2/8 = 1/4 (divide both numerator and denominator by 2), so they used the same amount.

questions.text: Place each fraction in the correct category based on whether it is less than, equal to, or greater than 1/2.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: Which fraction is NOT equivalent to 1/2?
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: Match each pair of fractions to determine if the first is greater than, less than, or equal to the second.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: John says 3/4 and 6/8 are equivalent fractions. Is he correct?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 3/4 = 6/8 because 3/4 x 2/2 = 6/8. They represent the same value.

questions.text: 2/6 and 1/3 represent the same amount.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 2/6 = 1/3 because both numerator and denominator can be divided by 2.

questions.text: A rectangle is divided into 8 equal parts. Lisa shades 6 parts. Which fraction is equivalent to the shaded portion?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 6/8 = 3/4 when simplified (divide both by 2).

questions.text: Arrange these fractions from smallest to largest: 1/2, 1/3, 1/6, 1/4.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: For unit fractions, larger denominators mean smaller values: 1/6 < 1/4 < 1/3 < 1/2

questions.text: Emma and Noah each have an identical chocolate bar. Emma eats 2/6 of hers. Noah eats 1/3 of his. Who ate more chocolate?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 2/6 = 1/3 (equivalent fractions), so they ate the same amount.

questions.text: Which shows the fractions 1/8, 4/8, and 6/8 correctly ordered on a number line from 0 to 1?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: On a number line from 0 to 1, fractions increase from left to right: 1/8 < 4/8 < 6/8

questions.text: Match each fraction with ALL its equivalent fractions from the list.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: A recipe calls for 3/4 cup of flour. Marcus only has a 1/8 cup measuring cup. How many 1/8 cups equal 3/4 cup?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 3/4 = 6/8, so 6 of the 1/8 cups would equal 3/4 cup.

questions.text: A number line from 0 to 1 shows a point at 5/6. Which statement is true?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 5/6 is greater than 1/2 (which would be 3/6), so it is closer to 1 than to 0.

questions.text: What is 4 x 6?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 4 x 6 = 24. This is a basic multiplication fact.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 7 x 8 = 56 is correct.

questions.text: What is 36 divided by 4?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 36 / 4 = 9 because 4 x 9 = 36.

questions.text: Match each multiplication to its product.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: Sarah has 3 bags with 7 apples in each bag. How many apples does she have in all?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 3 bags x 7 apples = 21 apples total.

questions.text: 48 divided by 6 equals 8.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 48 / 6 = 8 because 6 x 8 = 48.

questions.text: What is 345 + 278?
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: Order these multiplication problems from smallest product to largest.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: What is 800 - 356?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 800 - 356 = 444. This requires regrouping from hundreds.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: This is the commutative property of multiplication. Both equal 54.

questions.text: A classroom has 5 rows of desks with 6 desks in each row. How many desks are there?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 5 rows x 6 desks = 30 desks total.

questions.text: Match each division problem to its quotient.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: What is 7 x 10?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: When multiplying by 10, add a zero to the end: 7 x 10 = 70.

questions.text: 42 divided by 7 equals 7.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: What is the perimeter of a rectangle with length 8 cm and width 5 cm?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Perimeter = 2 x length + 2 x width = 2 x 8 + 2 x 5 = 16 + 10 = 26 cm

questions.text: Order these times from earliest to latest.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Order: 9:15 AM, 11:30 AM, 3:45 PM

questions.text: What is the area of a rectangle with length 6 units and width 4 units?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Area = length x width = 6 x 4 = 24 square units

questions.text: A square has all four sides equal in length.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: A square is a special rectangle where all four sides have the same length.

questions.text: Match each shape to its number of sides.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Triangle = 3, Quadrilateral = 4, Pentagon = 5, Hexagon = 6

questions.text: What is 5 x 8?
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: A rhombus is a quadrilateral with all sides equal.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: A rhombus is a quadrilateral (4 sides) where all sides are equal length.

questions.text: Tom has 24 stickers. He wants to share them equally among 4 friends. How many stickers does each friend get?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 24 / 4 = 6 stickers per friend.

questions.text: Order these numbers from smallest to largest.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: What is 567 rounded to the nearest hundred?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 567 is closer to 600 than 500. The tens digit is 6, which is 5 or more, so round up.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: This is the distributive property. Both sides equal 18.

questions.text: A movie started at 2:15 PM and lasted 1 hour and 45 minutes. What time did it end?
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: Match each product to its factors.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: What number makes this equation true? 8 x ___ = 72
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 8 x 9 = 72, so the missing number is 9.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 56 / 8 = 7 because 8 x 7 = 56.

questions.text: Arrange these operations in order from smallest result to largest.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: The perimeter of a square with side length 9 cm is:
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Perimeter of a square = 4 x side = 4 x 9 = 36 cm

questions.text: Match the measurement to its unit.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Pencil weight = grams, book length = centimeters, water bottle volume = liters

questions.text: If you divide a shape into 8 equal parts and shade 4 parts, you have shaded half the shape.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 4/8 = 1/2, so yes, 4 out of 8 equal parts is half the shape.

questions.text: A farmer has 63 carrots to put equally into 9 bags. How many carrots go in each bag?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 63 / 9 = 7 carrots per bag.

questions.text: 1 kilogram is heavier than 1 gram.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 1 kilogram = 1000 grams, so 1 kg is much heavier than 1 g.

questions.text: What is 234 rounded to the nearest ten?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 234 has a 4 in the ones place. Since 4 < 5, round down to 230.

questions.text: Order these fractions from largest to smallest.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: For unit fractions, smaller denominators mean larger fractions: 1/2 > 1/4 > 1/8

questions.text: A triangle has exactly 3 corners (vertices).
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: A triangle is a shape with exactly 3 sides and 3 corners.

questions.text: If the area of a rectangle is 35 square units and one side is 5 units, what is the other side?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Area = length x width. 35 = 5 x width, so width = 35 / 5 = 7 units.

questions.text: Match each number to its rounded value (to the nearest hundred).
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 438 rounds to 400, 472 rounds to 500, 516 rounds to 500

questions.text: A baker made 4 trays of cookies. Each tray has 8 cookies. If he sells 15 cookies, how many are left?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Total cookies: 4 x 8 = 32. After selling: 32 - 15 = 17 cookies left.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 9 x 9 = 81 is a basic multiplication fact.

questions.text: What is the missing number? 7 x ___ = 42
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 7 x 6 = 42, so the missing number is 6.

questions.text: Place these areas in order from smallest to largest.
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: Which quadrilateral has exactly 2 pairs of parallel sides?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: A parallelogram has 2 pairs of parallel sides. Rectangles, squares, and rhombuses are all types of parallelograms.

questions.text: Match each word problem to the correct operation.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Groups of = multiplication, shared by = division, plus = addition

questions.text: A rectangle can be divided into unit squares to find its area.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Area can be found by counting unit squares that cover a rectangle without gaps or overlaps.

questions.text: Maria practiced piano for 45 minutes on Monday and 55 minutes on Tuesday. How many total minutes did she practice?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 45 + 55 = 100 minutes total practice time.

questions.text: An L-shaped figure is made of two rectangles. One rectangle has area 12 square units and the other has area 8 square units. What is the total area?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Total area = 12 + 8 = 20 square units. Add the areas of the two rectangles.

questions.text: Jake has 5 boxes of crayons with 9 crayons in each box. He gives away 18 crayons. Then he buys 2 more boxes. How many crayons does Jake have now?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Start: 5 x 9 = 45. After giving away: 45 - 18 = 27. After buying: 27 + (2 x 9) = 27 + 18 = 45 crayons.
